member.summary: The accumulation chart control is used to visualize the data in the different types of graphical representations with built-in features like Grouping, legends, tooltip, and more.
Accumulation chart is a Data visualization component which is divided into slices to represent the given numerical values. In this each slice represents its corresponding numerical value.

member.summary: Annotation is a user defined HTML element that can be placed on chart We can use annotations to pile up the visual elegance of the chart. Specifies the customization of annotation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartAnnotation.ContentTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the content template for the annotation.
member.value: The template content is applied for the chart annotation based on the custom template provided by the user that is being rendered. The default value is null.
member.remarks: The is used to define a custom template for the chart annotation.

example.code:
Annotation in Pixel
 ...

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartAnnotation.CoordinateUnits
member.summary: Gets or sets the annotation’s coordinate units, either in Pixel or Point.
member.value:
One of the enumerations that specifies the coordinate units of an annotation. The options include: - Pixel: Annotation renders based on x and y pixel values. - Point: Annotation renders based on x and y axis values.
The default value is Units.Pixel.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartAnnotation.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets information about the annotation for assistive technology.
member.value: A string providing additional details or context about the annotation that can be utilized by assistive technology.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartAnnotation.Region
member.summary: Gets or sets the regions to insert annotations in relation to a series or a chart.
member.value:
One of the enumerations that specifies the regions of an annotation. The options include: - Chart: Annotation renders based on chart coordinates. - Series: Annotation renders based on series coordinates.
The default value is Regions.Chart.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartAnnotation.X
member.summary: Gets or sets the X-coordinate value for the annotation.
member.value: If the coordinate unit is set to , this property specifies the axis value. Otherwise, it specifies the pixel or percentage of the coordinate. The default value is zero.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartAnnotation.XAxisName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the horizontal axis associated with the annotation.
member.value: The name of the horizontal axis.
member.remarks: This property requires the presence of the 'Axes' of the chart.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartAnnotation.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the Y-coordinate value for the annotation.
member.value: If the coordinate unit is set to , this property specifies the axis value. Otherwise, it specifies the pixel or percentage of the coordinate. The default value is zero.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartAnnotation.YAxisName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the vertical axis associated with the annotation.
member.value: The name of the vertical axis.
member.remarks: This property requires the presence of the 'Axes' of the chart.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the axis should be rendered in an inversed manner.
member.value: true if the axis should be rendered in an inversed manner; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartAxis.OpposedPosition

member.value: true if the axis should render at the opposite position; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: For a horizontal axis, setting to true will position the axis at the top of the chart. For a vertical axis, setting to true will position the axis at the right side of the chart.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartAxis.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the title of an axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartAxis.ValueType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of data the axis is handling.
member.value:
One of the enumerations that specifies the value type of the axis. Options include: - Double: Renders a numeric axis. - DateTime: Renders a date time axis. - Category: Renders a category axis. - Logarithmic: Renders a logarithmic axis. - DateTimeCategory : Renders a date time category axis.
The default value is ValueType.Double.
member.remarks: This property determines the type of data the axis is handling, and it affects the way axis values are interpreted and displayed on the chart. It is essential to set this property correctly based on the nature of the data being plotted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartAxis.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the axis elements such as axis labels, tick lines, grid lines, and axis title should be visible.
member.value: true if the axis and its associated elements are visible; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Set this property to control the visibility of various axis elements. When set to false, the axis and its associated elements will not be rendered on the chart.

member.remarks: Applicable only for Polar and Radar series type charts.

member.remarks: This property is applicable only when the chart area is divided into multiple plot areas using the . To bind a horizonatal axis to a specific column, set the axis’s ColumnIndex property to that column’s index.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartAxis.EdgeLabelPlacement
member.summary: Gets or sets the placement of labels at the edge of the axis.
member.value:
One of the enumerations that specify the edge label placement for the axis. The options include: - None: No action will be performed, and the label will be rendered as it is. - Hide: Hides the edge label if it exceeds the chart area. - Shift: Shifts the edge labels within the chart area.
The default mode is EdgeLabelPlacement.None.
member.remarks: The longer text labels at the axis edges may only be partially visible in the chart. Utilize this property to place the edge labels efficiently for a better user experience.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartAxis.IntervalType
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval type for the DateTime-based axis.
member.value:
One of the enumerations that specifies the interval type for the DateTime-based axis. The options include: - Auto: Defines the interval of the axis based on data. - Years: Defines the interval of the axis in years. - Months: Defines the interval of the axis in months. - Days: Defines the interval of the axis in days. - Hours: Defines the interval of the axis in hours. - Minutes: Defines the interval of the axis in minutes.
The default value is IntervalType.Auto.

member.summary: Gets or sets the interval for the axis.
member.value: The numeric value representing the interval for the axis. The default value is .
member.remarks: The interval can be customized using for DateTime-based axis and for logarithmic-based axis. For example, if the interval is set to 2 and the is set to Years, it considers 2 years to be the interval.

member.remarks: The ZoomPosition property determines the relative position of the zoomed axis during zoom operations. A value of 0 represents the start of the axis, and a value of 1 represents the end of the axis. This property is used in conjunction with the property to control the zoom behavior along the axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartAxis.LabelIntersectAction
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies how to arrange axis labels intelligently when they intersect with each other.
member.value: One of the enumerations that specifies the alignment of axis labels when they intersect. The options include: - None: Show all labels, regardless of intersections. - Hide: Hide labels that intersect with each other. - Trim: Trim labels to fit within the available space when they intersect. - Wrap: Wrap labels to multiple lines when they intersect. - MultipleRows: Display labels in multiple rows when they intersect. - Rotate45: Rotate labels by 45 degrees when they intersect. - Rotate90: Rotate labels by 90 degrees when they intersect. The default LabelIntersectAction is LabelIntersectAction.Trim.
member.remarks: Note: For the vertical axis, the option is the only applicable choice.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartMultiLevelLabel
member.summary: Options to customize the multilevel label of the axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartMultiLevelLabel.Alignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the multi-level labels in the chart.
member.value: One of the enumeration values that specifies the alignment of the multi-level labels. The options include: - Near: Places the labels at the left end of the multi-level label rectangle if in a horizontal axis and places them at the top end of the multi-level label rectangle if in a vertical axis. - Center: Places the multi-level labels at the center. - Far: Places the labels at the right end of the multi-level label rectangle if in a horizontal axis and places them at the bottom end of the multi-level label rectangle if in a vertical axis. The default value is Alignment.Center.

member.summary: Gets or sets a list of representing the categories for multi-level labels.
member.value: A list of .
member.remarks: The Start, End, Text, and MaximumTextWidth of multilevel labels can be customized using the which accepts the collections of ChartCategory.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartMultiLevelLabel.Overflow
member.summary: Gets or sets the text overflow behavior for multi-level labels.
member.value:
One of the enumeration that specifies the text overflow options. The options include: - TextOverflow.Trim: Trims the text if it exceeds the defined margins. - TextOverflow.Wrap: Wraps the text if it exceeds the defined margins. - TextOverflow.None: Shows the text as it is.
The default value is TextOverflow.Wrap.

member.summary: Defines the current MouseY.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartMouseEventArgs.ID
member.summary: Gets the ID of the chart component when mouse events are triggered.
member.value: The value of the chart component’s id. The default value is chart component’s auto generated id.
member.remarks: It is read only value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartMouseEventArgs.AxisData
member.summary: Gets the axis values of the chart component when mouse events are triggered.
member.value: The collection of axes data where the key is the axis name, and the value is the axis values for the location. The default value is null.
member.remarks: This value is read-only and provides information about the axis values for chart interactions.
member.example:
<SfChart>
                <ChartEvents ChartMouseClick = "MouseClick" ></ ChartEvents >
                < !--Chart Configuration -->
             </SfChart>
             @code {
                 void MouseClick(ChartMouseEventArgs Args)
                 {
                     if (Args.AxisData.TryGetValue("PrimaryXAxis", out object xValue) && Args.AxisData.TryGetValue("PrimaryYAxis", out object yValue))
                     {
                         AddToDataSource(xValue, yValue);
                     }
                 }
            
                 void AddToDataSource(object xValue, object yValue)
                 {
                     // Add the X and Y values to the data source here.
                 }
             }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartDefaultConnector
member.summary: Specifies the connector line style.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartDefaultConnector.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the connector line.
member.value:
One of the enumerations that specifies the type of the connector line. The options include: - Line: Renders the connector line as a straight line. - Curve: Renders the connector line as a curved line.
The default type is ConnectorType.Line.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartDefaultConnector.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the connector line.
member.value: A string representing the color of the connector line. The default value is "black".
member.remarks: Accepts values in hex and rgba as a valid CSS color string.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartDefaultConnector.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the connector line.
member.value: A double value representing the width of the connector line. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartDefaultConnector.Length
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of the connector line.
member.value: A string representing the length of the connector line. The default value is null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartDefaultConnector.DashArray
member.summary: Gets or sets the dashArray for the connector line.
member.value: A string representing the dashArray for the connector line. The default value is null.
member.remarks: The property allows customization of the connector line by specifying a dash pattern. This string value defines the pattern of dashes and gaps in the line. For example, "4,2" represents a dash of length 4 followed by a gap of length 2.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartDefaultFont
member.summary: Sets and gets the options for customizing the text style of the chart component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartDefaultFont.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the color for the text.
member.value: A string representing the color for the text. The default value is null.
member.remarks: Accepts values in hex and rgba as a valid CSS color string.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartDefaultFont.FontFamily
member.summary: Gets or sets the font family for the text.
member.value: A string representing the font family for the text. The default value is "Segoe UI".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartDefaultFont.FontStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the font style for the text.
member.value: A string representing the font style for the text. The default value is "Normal".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartDefaultFont.FontWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the font weight for the text.
member.value: A string representing the font weight for the text. The default value is "Normal".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartDefaultFont.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity for the text.
member.value: A double value representing the opacity for the text. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartDefaultFont.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the font size for the text.
member.value: A string representing the font size for the text. The default value is "16px".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartDefaultFont.TextAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the text alignment.
member.value:
One of the enumerations that specifies the alignment of the text. The options include: - Near - Center - Far
The default value is Alignment.Center.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartDefaultFont.TextOverflow
member.summary: Gets or sets the text overflow behavior to employ when the text exceeds the defined margins.
member.value:
One of the enumeration that specifies the text overflow options. The options include: - TextOverflow.Trim: Trims the text if it exceeds the defined margins. - TextOverflow.Wrap: Wraps the text if it exceeds the defined margins. - TextOverflow.None: Shows the text as it is.
The default value is TextOverflow.Trim.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartIndicator
member.summary: Defines the technical indicator, that are used in financial markets.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartIndicator.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the technical indicator.
member.value:
One of the enumerations that specifies the type of technical indicators. The options include: - Sma: Predicts the trend using a simple moving average approach. - Ema: Predicts the trend using an exponential moving average approach. - Tma: Predicts the trend using a triangle moving average approach. - Momentum: Predicts the trend using a momentum approach. - Atr: Predicts the trend using an average true range approach. - AccumulationDistribution: Predicts the trend using an accumulation distribution approach. - BollingerBands: Predicts the trend using a Bollinger approach. - Macd: Predicts the trend using moving average convergence divergence approach. - Stochastic: Predicts the trend using a stochastic approach. - Rsi: Predicts the trend using RSI approach.
The default value is TechnicalIndicators.Sma.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartIndicator.Period
member.summary: Gets or sets the period over which price changes will be considered to predict the trend.
member.value: A double representing the period. The default value is 14.
member.remarks: This property defines the time span over which price changes are taken into account for trend prediction. Adjusting this value can impact the sensitivity of trend analysis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartIndicator.KPeriod
member.summary: Gets or sets the look-back period over which price changes will define the %K value in stochastic indicators.
member.value: A double representing the look-back period. The default value is 14.
member.remarks: This property determines the period over which price changes are considered to calculate the %K value in stochastic indicators.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartIndicator.DPeriod
member.summary: Gets or sets the period over which price changes will define the %D value in stochastic indicators.
member.value: A double value representing the DPeriod value in stochastic indicators. The default value is 3.
member.remarks: This property determines the period over which price changes are considered to calculate the %D value in stochastic indicators.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartIndicator.OverBought
member.summary: Gets or sets the over-bought (threshold) values.
member.value: A double representing the over-bought threshold values. The default value is 80.
member.remarks: This property is only applicable to RSI and stochastic indicators.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartIndicator.OverSold
member.summary: Gets or sets the over-sold (threshold) values.
member.value: A double representing the over-sold threshold values. The default value is 20.
member.remarks: This property is only applicable to RSI and stochastic indicators.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartIndicator.StandardDeviation
member.summary: Gets or sets the standard deviation values used to define the upper and lower Bollinger Bands.
member.value: A double representing the standard deviation values. The default value is 2.
member.remarks: This property is applicable only for the Bollinger Bands indicator type. It determines the number of standard deviations to be used in calculating the upper and lower bands.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartIndicator.Field
member.summary: Gets or sets the field to compare the current value with previous values.
member.value:
One of the enumeration that specifies the financial data fields to compare the current value with previous values. The options include: - High: Defines the highest price in the stocks over time. - Low: Defines the lowest price in the stocks over time. - Open: Defines the opening price in the stocks over time. - Close: Defines the closing price in the stocks over time.
The default value is FinancialDataFields.Close.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartIndicator.SlowPeriod
member.summary: Gets or sets the slow period used to define the MACD line.
member.value: A double representing the slow period for defining the MACD line. The default value is 12.
member.remarks: This property is applicable only for the MACD (Moving Average Convergence Divergence) indicator. It is used to customize the MACD period, influencing the calculation of the MACD line.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartIndicator.FastPeriod
member.summary: Gets or sets the fast period used to define the MACD line.
member.value: A double representing the fast period for defining the MACD line. The default value is 26.
member.remarks: This property is applicable only for the MACD (Moving Average Convergence Divergence) indicator. It is used to customize the MACD period, influencing the calculation of the MACD line.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show over-bought and over-sold regions.
member.value: true to show over-bought and over-sold regions; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: This property is only applicable to RSI and stochastic indicators.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartLegendSettings.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets an instance of that specifies the location of the legend relative to the chart. If x is set to 20, the legend will move 20 pixels to the right of the chart.
member.value: The default value is an instance of .
member.remarks: The must be set to LegendPosition.Custom to position the legend in the chart using the specified x and y offsets.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartLegendSettings.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the legend in the chart.
member.value:
One of the enumeration that specifies the position of the legend. The options include: - Auto: Places the legend based on based on width and height - Top : Displays the legend at the top of the chart. - Left : Displays the legend at the left of the chart. - Bottom: Displays the legend at the bottom of the chart. - Right: Displays the legend at the right of the chart. - Custom: Displays the legend based on the given x and y location values.
The default mode is LegendPosition.Auto.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartLegendSettings.Padding
member.summary: Gets or sets the padding around the legend collection.
member.value: A double representing the padding around the legend collection. The default value is 8.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartLegendSettings.ItemPadding
member.summary: Gets or sets the padding between legend items.
member.value: A double representing the padding between legend items. The default value is 20.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartLegendSettings.Alignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of the legend.
member.value:
One of the enumerations that specifies the legend alignment. Options include: - Near: Aligns the legend to the left or top based on the . - Center: Aligns the legend to the center of the chart. - Far: Aligns the legend to the right or bottom based on the .
The default value is Alignment.Center.
member.remarks: The alignment of the legend works as follows: - Near: Aligns the legend to the top-left of the chart if is LegendPosition.Top and to the right-top of the chart if is LegendPosition.Right. - Center: Aligns the legend to the top center of the chart if is LegendPosition.Top and to the right center of the chart if is LegendPosition.Right. - Far: Aligns the legend to the top-right of the chart if is LegendPosition.Top and to the right-bottom of the chart if is LegendPosition.Right.

The default value is .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartSeries.AccessibilityDescription
member.summary: Gets or sets the accessibility description for the .
member.value: Accepts a string that defines the accessibility description for the . The default value is null.
member.remarks: Use this property to provide an accessibility description for the root element, which is the parent element of the series points.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartSeries.AccessibilityDescriptionFormat
member.summary:
Gets or sets the format for the points accessibility description of the . The format string can include the following placeholders:
${series.name}: Displays the name of the series.
${point.x}: Displays the x-value of the point.
${point.y}: Displays the y-value of the point.
${point.high}: Displays the high value of the point. This is applicable only for financial and range series.
${point.low}: Displays the low value of the point. This is applicable only for financial and range series.
${point.open}: Displays the open value of the point. This is applicable only for financial series.
${point.close}: Displays the close value of the point. This is applicable only for financial series.
member.value: Accepts a string that defines the format for the points accessibility description of the . The default value is null.
member.remarks: Use this property to specify the format for the points accessibility description of the . The property provides accessibility information for the series root element. However, this property allows you to provide dynamic information based on the data. For example, the format "${series.name} : ${point.x}" displays the series name and x-value of the point in the accessibility description.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartSeries.AccessibilityRole
member.summary: Gets or sets the accessibility role for the .
member.value: Accepts a string that defines the accessibility role for the . The default value is null.
member.remarks: Use this property to specify the accessibility role for the root element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartSeries.Focusable
member.summary: Gets or sets the accessibility keyboard navigation focus option for the .
member.value: Accepts a boolean value to enable or disable keyboard navigation for the . The default value is true.
member.remarks: Use this property to toggle keyboard navigation focus for the .

member.value: A string representing the highlight color. Accepts valid CSS color string values.
member.remarks: Applicable only when is applied. Chart points, series or a cluster of points (based on the applied and chart series type) will be displayed in the provided HighlightColor when the user hovers over them.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.SfChart.SelectionMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the selection mode of the chart component.
member.value:
One of the enumerations that specifies the selection mode of the chart component. The options include: - None: No selection will occur. - Series: Selects a series. - Point: Selects a single point. - Cluster: Selects the points in all series that correspond to the same index.
The default value is SelectionMode.None.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.SfChart.HighlightMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the highlight mode of the chart component.
member.value:
One of the enumeration that specifies the highlight mode of the chart component. The options include: - None: No highlighting will occur. - Series: Series will be highlighted when hovered. - Point: Point will be highlighted when hovered. - Cluster: A cluster of points in all series that correspond to the same index will be highlighted when hovered.
The default value is HighlightMode.None.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.SfChart.SelectionPattern

member.value: One of the enumerations that specifies the selecting patterns. The default value is SelectionPattern.None.
member.remarks: The provided pattern will be displayed on points, series, or a cluster of points (based on the applied).

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartDataEditSettings
member.summary: Options to customize the drag settings for series.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartDataEditSettings.Enable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable data editing by dragging the point.
member.value: true if data editing is enabled; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When set to true, users can interactively edit data points by dragging them on the chart.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartDataEditSettings.Fill
member.summary: Gets or sets the color for the edited point.
member.value: A string representing the color of the edited point.
member.remarks:
The property specifies the color of the point interior which will be assigned while dragging and will remain for the edited point. This property accepts values in hex and rgba as a valid CSS color string.
Note: It is not applicable to line-based series types such as Line, Step Line, and Spline.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartDataEditSettings.MaxY
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum Y value to which the point can be dragged for data editing.
member.value: The default value is .
member.remarks: This property helps control the upper limit for the Y-axis when interactively editing data points on the chart.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartDataEditSettings.MinY
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum Y value to which the point can be dragged for data editing.
member.value: The default value is .
member.remarks: This property helps control the lower limit for the Y-axis when interactively editing data points on the chart.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartZoomSettings
member.summary: Options to customize the zoom settings of the chart.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartZoomSettings.EnableDeferredZooming
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to update the chart with a delay while panning.
member.value: true if updating the chart with a delay while panning is enabled; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Enabling this option can provide a smoother user experience during panning by introducing a delay before the chart is updated.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartZoomSettings.EnableMouseWheelZooming
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the chart can be zoomed using the mouse wheel.
member.value: true if the chart can be zoomed using the mouse wheel; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Enabling this option allows users to zoom in or out on the chart by using the mouse wheel.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartZoomSettings.EnablePan
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the chart can be panned when zoomed.
member.value: true if the chart can be panned when zoomed; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Enabling this option allows users to pan across the zoomed-in chart area for better exploration of specific regions.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartZoomSettings.EnablePinchZooming
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the chart can be zoomed through pinch gestures on touch-enabled devices.
member.value: true if the chart can be zoomed through pinch gestures; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Enabling this option allows users to zoom in or zoom out on the chart by performing pinch gestures on touch-enabled devices.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartZoomSettings.EnableScrollbar
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the axis should have a scrollbar when zoomed.
member.value: true if the axis should have a scrollbar when zoomed; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Enabling this option allows users to navigate and visualize specific regions of the chart using scrollbar when zoomed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartZoomSettings.EnableSelectionZooming
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the chart can be zoomed by selecting a rectangular region on the plot area.
member.value: true if the chart can be zoomed by selecting a rectangular region on the plot area; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Enabling this option provides an interactive way for users to focus on specific areas of interest within the chart.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartZoomSettings.Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets the mode of zooming.
member.value:
One of the enumeration that specifies the mode of zooming. The options include: - XY: Chart can be zoomed both vertically and horizontally. - X: Chart can be zoomed horizontally. - Y: Chart can be zoomed vertically.
The default mode is ZoomMode.XY.
member.remarks: This property can be set to allow zooming both vertically and horizontally, only horizontally, or only vertically.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartZoomSettings.ToolbarDisplayMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the visibility mode for the zooming toolbar in the chart.
member.value:
One of the enumeration that specifies the visibility mode for the zooming toolbar. The options include: - OnDemand: The zooming toolbar is only visible while the chart has zoomed. - Always: The zooming toolbar is always visible even though the chart has not zoomed. - None: The zooming toolbar will not be visible even though the chart is zoomed.
The default value is ToolbarMode.OnDemand.
member.remarks: It determines whether the toolbar should be visible only when the chart is zoomed, always visible, or never visible.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartZoomSettings.ToolbarItems
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of items to be added in the toolbar for the chart.
member.value: The list of to be displayed in the chart toolbar. The available items include: - Zoom - ZoomIn - ZoomOut - Pan - Reset
member.remarks: The property allows customization of the items displayed in the chart toolbar. Users can choose from a set of predefined items, such as Zoom, ZoomIn, ZoomOut, Pan, and Reset, to be included in the toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartZoomSettings.AccessibilityDescriptionFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format for the toolkit accessibility description of the chart zoom toolkit.
member.value: Accepts a string that defines the format for the toolkit accessibility description of the chart zoom toolkit. The default value is null.
member.remarks: Use this property to specify a format for the toolkit accessibility description of the chart zoom toolkit. The placeholder ${value} can be used to set the accessibility text for the zoom toolkit toolbar item name. For example, the format "Selected the ${value} option" will read as "Selected the ZoomIn option" for the button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartCrosshairSettings.LineType
member.summary: Gets or sets the line type for the crosshair.
member.value:
One of the enumerations that specifies the type of the crosshair line. The options include: - None: Hides both vertical and horizontal crosshair lines. - Both: Shows both vertical and horizontal crosshair lines. - Vertical: Shows the vertical line. - Horizontal: Shows the horizontal line.
The default mode is LineType.Both.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the tooltip is enabled.

member.value: true if tooltip animation is enabled; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartTooltipSettings.EnableMarker
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display a marker in the tooltip.
member.value: true if the marker should be displayed in the tooltip; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: If set to true, the marker shape assigned for the series associated with the hovered point is applied for the tooltip marker. If the marker is not enabled, a circle-shaped marker will be rendered by default.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to wrap the tooltip text based on the available space.

member.summary: Gets or sets the duration for fading out the tooltip.
member.value: The fade-out duration in milliseconds. The default value is 1000.
member.remarks: This property determines the duration for the tooltip to fade out when the focus on the chart point is removed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartTooltipSettings.Fill
member.summary: Gets or sets the fill color of the tooltip background.
member.value: A string representing the fill color of the tooltip background. The default fill color is determined by the chart's theme. By default, the theme is set to with a fill color of #000816.
member.remarks: The fill color accepts values in hex and rgba as a valid CSS color string.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartTooltipSettings.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the format for the tooltip content.
member.value: A string that defines the format for the tooltip content. The default value is an empty string.
member.remarks:
The property allows customization of the tooltip content. By default, the tooltip displays information for the x and y values of a point. Additional information can be included in the tooltip using a format string.
For example, the format "$series.name : $point.x" displays the series name and x-value of the point in the tooltip.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartTooltipSettings.Header
member.summary: Gets or sets the header text for the tooltip.
member.value: A string representing the tooltip header text. The default value is an empty string.
member.remarks: This property can be used to provide additional context or information related to the data point being displayed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartTooltipSettings.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity of the tooltip.
member.value: A double value specifying the opacity of the tooltip. The default value is 0.75.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartTooltipSettings.Shared
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a single tooltip should be displayed with shared values of multiple series.
member.value: true if a single tooltip should be displayed with shared values of multiple series; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Enabling this option allows for the presentation of combined information from all relevant series in a unified tooltip.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartTooltipSettings.ShowNearestPoint
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the values of the nearest points for all visible series in the shared tooltip are allowed to display in the tooltip.
member.value: true if the values of the nearest points are shown in the tooltip; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: This property is applicable only for shared tooltip. Enabling this option allows for the presentation of values from the nearest data points of multiple series in the shared tooltip.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Charts.ChartTooltipSettings.Template

member.value: The template content is applied for the chart tooltip based on the custom template provided by the user that is being rendered. The default value is null.
member.remarks: Use ${x} and ${y} as placeholder text to display the corresponding data point in the custom template.
